subject: History
title: Mexican Independence
description: Learn Mexican Independence in one minute.

hook.text: Mexico's independence started with a parish priest ringing a church bell at midnight. His cry echoed for a decade.

buildup.text: In 1810, Father Miguel Hidalgo rallied Indigenous and mestizo followers with the Grito de Dolores.

discovery.text: Hidalgo's army of 80,000 peasants terrified both the Spanish and Mexico's own eliteâ€”they lacked weapons, not fury.

twist.text: Hidalgo was captured and executed within a year. His head was displayed on a wall for ten years as a warning.

climax.text: Independence finally came in 1821â€”not through revolution but when a royalist general switched sides.

punchline.text: The revolution's hero died, but his bell still rings.

quiz.question: How did Mexican independence actually come about in 1821?
options: A peasant army stormed Mexico City
A royalist general switched sides and negotiated independence
Spain voluntarily granted independence after Napoleon's defeat
